My third grade teacher used to play this for us before EVERY TEST so that we can clear our minds and do well on each test. Can you imagine a bunch of 3rd graders singing along to seal lol. Its the greatest memory I have of her. I will never forget her. I appreciate that she taught us to relax during high stress situations and to just breathe. My ability to stay cool calm and collected during high stress situations is because of Mrs McBee. I'll be 30 next year and this song always makes me flash back to 3rd grade. I can even remember where I sat in class and what the classroom looked like just by listening to this song. As soon as the song ends, I can't remember ANYTHING.

Such a difficult song to sing. It requires immense breath control, supreme vocal control, astonishingly accurate melismas and riffs, pinpoint octave leaps, stellar vocal dynamics, but most of all... it requires the singer to not only have excellent mixing technique, but to be able to sing in the middle of their voice, usually where it cracks. Phew! This is vocal suicide and why it deserves to be in the Top 5 Mariah Carey songs not to try at home!

After all the hate she's getting on social media now, watching this made me quite emotional. This woman has been touching her fans' lives and pouring her heart and soul to her music for more than 25 years already. At least respect that fact. Mariah Carey is one of the greatest artists in the history of recorded music.

songs.song: (God Must Have Spent) A Little More Time On You - Remix
songs.comment_text: I dedicated this to my son, Jaxon when he was born. He has Down Syndrome. Everyone thought it was too difficult and scary to take care of a special needs baby. I thought God spent some extra time on him to make him perfect and i feel blessed everyday that Jax chose me to be his mommy. I knew the second I saw him that he was my purpose in life. I was born to be his mommy. He is 5 now and I don't know how I survived life without him. I wouldn't change not 1 single thing about him. The only scary part about it is living with your heart outside of your body. My son is my heart. üñ§

I was pregnant for my daughter when this song came out, I used to sing it to my pregnant belly, and after she was born I sang it as a lullaby to her while I rocked her to sleep at night.  She's 19 years old today, and this song still holds true.  I loved  her before I met her, she's the baby girl I always dreamed of having, and she became my best friend.  This song will always be beautiful and so very special!

songs.song: I'll Be Missing You (feat. Faith Evans, 112)
songs.comment_text: This song is for my son that I lost when he was 22 years old, hard to believe it will be 21 years in 2022.  The pain never leaves me.  I love you son.

songs.song: When You Say Nothing At All
songs.comment_text:
This is the song that was in the charts when my daughter was born on 6th April 2000, at 13 weeks premature, weighing just 1000g, she was so very tiny, frail and fragile and her skin was transparent, she couldn't speak, move or even open her eyes, but she told me she would fight for her life and always be in my life.


The song struck a very emotional note in me, as she laid there in her intensive care incubator, fighting for life.  On her third day, she was diagnosed as having Hydrocephalus, where her skull was filling with water from her body, she had emergency surgery that day, to temporarily drain the fluid building up, it worked, but we were given the news that this had been caused by bleeds on her brain, we were also told she was showing signs that she had been starved of oxygen during the difficult birth and emergency ceasarian, and that this would most likely have caused Brain Damage leading to Cerebral Palsy.  This was confirmed two days later, we were told that her Cerebral palsy could be as mild as Dyslexia or as severe as that she would never know who she was and be wheelchair bound for her entire life, only time would tell.


The song seemed to be everywhere, on every radio station, every TV programme and each time it played, an overwhelming emotional connection grew stronger and stronger, it became the song that even to this day, brings that sunami of emotions and memories of that time crashing down upon me, fetching me to tears everytime.  But those tears were never ones of loss and grieving, they were always of joy and loving, of strength and determination....


Amber, as we named her, will soon be 20 years old, she is a great source of strength for me and her mother.  There have been many, many surgeries along the way, Amber has managed to show strength throughout it all, remaining a happy smiling, positive child.


I cannot call her a child anymore, as she frequently tells me, she is a young woman now.  It has been a long, hard journey for her, but she has learned strength & courage far beyond her short years.  She is now able to talk, and boy, do we know it, she can walk short distances with her walking frame and splints, she still has problems, which we deal with as they occur.  She is my rock, a beacon of stability, she is my daughter.

She turned 20 today, 6th April 2020.
Just lost my son 2 weeks ago, he only lived 13 hours in the world. And I miss him so much, wish I could kiss and hug him longer. Please pray for him in heavenüôèüôèüò•üíê
Any kid who heard this track growing up in 90s will remember this enchanting tune forever.

I am 43 and I could literally overdose on nostalgia. The 90's was the last decade where there was still an innocence to life. They had the best movies, tv, and music. I sometimes sit and just close my eyes and go back to this time on my mind...just immersing myself in all the memories. I cry a lot just yearning for those days that I can never get back. The world is such a üí©show today and I just wish I could be a kid again. Just wanting to relive all those precious times üò¢. I thank God for Youtube...one of the only online platforms I really look at. Long live the 90's !!!! üëçüëçüëçüíúüíúüíú

When my little sister past away in August 1986 at the age of 6, and this song was playing on the radio. I can remember listening to it. I was eight at the time when she passed away. The line that says, "I thought I heard your voice yesterday, then I turned around to say that I loved you, then I realized that it was just my mind playing tricks on me", sticks with me. I remember my mom saying she would hear her voice. She even said she saw her in our home. I remember trying to remember the way her voice sounded. As time went by I forgot her voice. It's been 32 years and my baby sister April Nicole Thomas... I miss you, there's no other way to say it. I'm crying as I write this. I will love you forever. My best friend always. Until we meet again.

I don't know why but I cry every time I watch this video. Maybe because it shows us a life of an introvert office worker Taylor who is bullied, others gossip about her and just when we think nothing special will happen, there is the scene of her reunion with her lover, who managed to come back from war. And this quick moment for me is so powerful. This video shows us that we see only a small piece of others lives. Just because they seem to be boring, lonely or strange, doesn't mean that they are not a ray of light in lives of others. Respect each other, love each other, help each other. This is the only thing that matters...

songs.post_title: Best Wedding Songs and Love Songs - Spotify Playlist 2025
songs.comment_text:
Hi guys! Sorry for the long wait since our last video. We've been busy recording tons of new stuff and we're excited to share it all with you very soon! 
Some of you know that we occasionally play for weddings. As you can imagine, we get a lot of requests for Canon in D, and we discovered that there were no good arrangements available anywhere for piano and cello! Hard to believe given its popularity. So we decided to make our own! We tried to stick as closely to the original as possible (which was written for three violins and basso continuo), and we like to perform it *not* at a snail's pace so the bride can actually make it down the aisle without putting everyone to sleep. üôä(Yeah, we said it! Nobody likes a slow processional!) Also, the number one complaint about this piece from cellists is always how booooring it is to play because they literally have to play the same 8 bass notes over and over for the entire piece. Problem solved with this arrangement because the cello never has to play the bass! üôå(The piano does, but we get lots of other fun stuff too so it's ok!) So for all you musicians out there playing weddings, we hope you enjoy playing this arrangement a little more than the ones you were used to...You can get it from us here: https://www.brooklynduo.com/sheet-music. üòäBe sure to let us know in the comments if you do!

songs.comment_text: Right now, there are people all over the world who are just like you. They're either lonely, they're missing somebody, they're depressed, they're hurt, they're scarred from the past, they're having personal issues no one knows about, they have secrets you wouldn't believe. They wish, they dream and they hope. And right now, they are sitting here reading these words, and I'm writing this for you so you don‚Äôt feel alone anymore. What really helped me start overcoming the pain and actually move toward my goals was reading Manifest the Unseen by Luna Rivers, it opened my eyes in ways I didn‚Äôt expect. Always remember, don‚Äôt be depressed about the past, don‚Äôt worry about the future, and just focus on today. ‚ù§

songs.song: I Can't Get Next To You
songs.comment_text: I am 42 years old, I wasn't even around for the Motown era, but everything about the Temptations is solid gold. My grandmother gets full credit for forcing me to listen to this style of music when I was a kid. Thanks grandma!
No group ever had both the singers and choreography like this group did. The best ever.

My parents have been married for 26 years, had 6 kids and my dad always puts this on after a family meal, sings and dances with my mom in the kitchen. It's nice to know in a generation full of divorce, that two people can still truly be in love with each other after all that time :-)

This song really touches a nerve in me.  I went off to college in 1971 and my girlfriend (senior in high school) promised she would wait for me to return and we'd get married.  We were too young to know how life works.  Our love letters gradually got colder and colder.  Eventually we broke up by way of nasty letters.  My heart was broken.  Then this song starts playing on the radio.  It seemed like the writer knew my story exactly.  Every time I hear this song, it takes me back to that painful time in my youth.  Well, we eventually did get back together.  We are still happily married with two sons and four grandchildren.
People say that i live in the past because i listen to 70s music everyday but in my defense how can you not... These gentleman had class and talent. ‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§

songs.song: You Make Me Feel Brand New
songs.comment_text: Hmm!.....this song was released 43 years ago! Still in rotation around the world! Be thankful that you grew up with this music, cherish the good memories!
My mom used to love singing this song. I can almost still hear her voice singin this. RIP mama 1972-2018. I miss her so much
These songs never age.

I'm 15, born in 2000. Sad to say but I'm one of the only people I know that love oldies! I have my modern hip hop side but only when I feel energetic, which is rare. Most of the time I'm chilling back and listening to oldies. My sister calls me weird but I don't care! I love this genre of music!
